attributes.title: Physical Stock Take
attributes.description:
·       A physical stock take was conducted on 15 January 2025 to establish whether the physical stock balances were matching the stock as per the SAP system and to determine if inventory controls in place are working effectively to minimize errors and fraud.

·       The physical stock count revealed the following:

ü  Bread stock had nil variation,

ü  Polybags had +455,

ü  White flour had +0.74kgs

ü  Utto had -0.78 Litres.

ü  Yeast and white ingredient had+0.01.

·       The table below illustrates the summary of the audit findings:

Table 1:Stock take summary

·        Crates had nil variation.

Implications

·       The stock take results indicate that inventory controls are generally effective, as most variances are minimal.

However, the positive and negative discrepancies in some items such as polybags (+455), white flour (+0.74 kg) and vegetable oil (-0.78 kg) highlight minor inconsistencies in stock management.
attributes.recommendation:
·       Branch management is encouraged to strengthen bread inventory controls to minimize the identified shortfall.

·       Branch management is also recommended to pay closer attention to frequently fluctuating inventory items such as packaging materials.

·       Branch management should analyse both past and current stock discrepancies to identify recurring patterns and implement corrective actions to prevent future variances.
attributes.effect:
·       The stock take results indicate that inventory controls are generally effective, as most variances are minimal.

However, the positive and negative discrepancies in some items such as polybags (+455), white flour (+0.74 kg) and vegetable oil (-0.78 kg) highlight minor inconsistencies in stock management.
attributes.remediation_plan:
• Strengthen stock reconciliation controls, especially for fluctuating items.
  • Analyze past discrepancies to detect recurring patterns and implement corrective actions.

value: ·       We are going to strengthen controls in places for all items and especially polybags to try and minimize variances noted.

·       We will continue maintaining the existing controls, including accurate record-keeping and monitoring of goods issuance.

However, the noted variances are minimal.

·       In the prior audit dated 9th January 2025,

ü  Poly bags had a cumulative variance of +955 pieces,

ü   Bread stock had a variance of -152 Pieces,

ü  White flour had a variance of +0.29 Kgs,

ü  Utto had a variance of +2.2 Litres,

ü  White Ingredient and Yeast each had a variance of +0.01 Kgs.

attributes.title: Bread Weight Check
attributes.description:
·       Bread produced and packed in the branch ready to be dispatched to the market were selected randomly and weighed, to determine if the bread met the standard Weight of 400g ,600g,800g and 1.5 kg as per the KEBS Standard weights.

·       Underweights were noted across all the varieties with few instances of overweight as illustrated below;      

ü  600g - 25%

ü  600g Bw - 6%

ü  800g - 68%

ü  800g Bw - 63%

ü  200g Ml- 85%

ü  400g - 44%

Table 2: Bread weight check summary.

Implications

·       The high percentage of underweight bread across all varieties poses a significant risk of non-compliance with KEBS standards, which may result in regulatory penalties and reputational damage.

·       The control panel malfunction in the oven is disrupting weight consistency affecting production efficiency and making it difficult for workers to track baking time accurately.

Consistently underweight bread may lead to customer complaints, loss of trust and potential market share reduction.
attributes.recommendation:
·       Branch management is encouraged to coordinate with KAF to speed up the repair and calibration of the oven control panel.

To resolve underweight and overweight issues, strict supervision of the bread production process should be enforced. This will ensure that any non-compliance is due to unavoidable factors like machine failures rather than worker negligence.
attributes.effect:
·       The high percentage of underweight bread across all varieties poses a significant risk of non-compliance with KEBS standards, which may result in regulatory penalties and reputational damage.

·       The control panel malfunction in the oven is disrupting weight consistency affecting production efficiency and making it difficult for workers to track baking time accurately.

Consistently underweight bread may lead to customer complaints, loss of trust and potential market share reduction.
attributes.remediation_plan:
• Urgently repair and calibrate the oven control panel.
  • Implement stricter production monitoring to maintain compliance with weight standards.

value:
·       We are experiencing oven issues that are significantly impacting weight, particularly due to a control panel malfunction, making it difficult for workers to track time.

·       We are coordinating with KAF to ensure the issue is resolved.
·       Control panel issues were a major factor in non-compliance with set weights. We will follow up to reduce instances of underweight by ensuring the entire process is strictly adhered to.

·       In the prior audit dated 9th January 2025, Packed bread underweight were noted as follows:

ü  600g BT 15%

ü  800CTW 8%

ü  400g CTW had 3%

ü  400 g Barrel 4%

ü  800g Barrel 12 %

attributes.title: Bread Damages Analysis
attributes.description:
a.     Production Damages and market damages.

Findings.

·       An analysis of production and market damages for the period of 21 Days from 17 December 2024 to 06 January 2025 was done to determine whether bread damages were within the required percentage threshold of 0.20% of total production and 0.50% of the total sales respectively.

·     It was noted that production damages were at 0.28% and had a cost implication of Kshs 22,868.49 while market damages were at 0.57% with a cost Implication of Kshs 18,855.68

·     The table below illustrates the summary of findings: -

Table 3: Production Damages analysis.

Table 4: Market Damages Analysis.

Implications

·       Oven breakdowns and generator delays significantly impacted production leading to damages and non-compliance with quality standards.

Higher market damages may indicate potential customer dissatisfaction due to quality issues.
attributes.recommendation: Branch management is encouraged to coordinate with KAF to strengthen preventive maintenance programs of key production machinery including generator and oven
attributes.effect:
·       Oven breakdowns and generator delays significantly impacted production leading to damages and non-compliance with quality standards.

Higher market damages may indicate potential customer dissatisfaction due to quality issues.
attributes.remediation_plan:
• Strengthen preventive maintenance for ovens and generators to reduce production damages.
  • Improve product handling and storage to minimize market damages.

value:
·       During this period, oven breakdowns led to production damages, while power issues also contributed as the generator took time to start when power went out.

·       The oven malfunctions also affected the quality of bread sent to the market resulting in market damages.

The generator issue has been resolved and the oven has been repaired

·       Oven breakdowns contributed to the observed production damages, though KAF addressed the issues as they arose.

·       Additionally, delays in the generator starting also impacted production.

We are now focused on ensuring that all bread produced meets high-quality standards to minimize market damages.

·       In the prior audit dated 9th January 2025, It was noted that;

ü  Production damages were at 0.28% of the production,

Market damages stood at 0.63% of the total sales.

attributes.title: Mixing Chart Analysis
attributes.description:
·       An analysis of both mixing chart and mixing chart summary was done for a period of 31 days from 7 January 2025 to 06 February 2025, the objective was to determine the average yield per production bag, actual utto consumption and if the branch production capacity was being fully utilized.

·       The analysis revealed the following.

ü  production target was at 84.35% of total capacity of 108 bags

ü  Average yield target per bag was 190.99 Loaves

ü  Utto consumption stood at 99.99%

ü  3,120 remixes were noted.

·       Below is the summary of the findings:

Table 5: Mixing Chart analysis Summary.

Implications

·       The production target was not fully achieved, reaching only 84.35% of total capacity which indicates underutilization of resources.

Frequent machine breakdowns disrupted production contributing to remixes and inefficiencies in Utto consumption.
attributes.recommendation: ·       Branch management is encouraged to align production schedules more effectively with market demand while maintaining operational efficiency.
attributes.effect:
·       The production target was not fully achieved, reaching only 84.35% of total capacity which indicates underutilization of resources.

Frequent machine breakdowns disrupted production contributing to remixes and inefficiencies in Utto consumption.
attributes.remediation_plan:
• Optimize production schedules to better align with demand.
  • Address frequent oven breakdowns contributing to remix cases.

value: ·       Due to market demand, production was adjusted accordingly leading to shift reductions to align with sales needs which in turn affected target achievement.

·       Production is primarily driven by market demand as was the case during that period. We therefore produced what we could supply to the market and thus had an effect on overall efficiency attainment.

However, frequent machine breakdowns also contributed to the failure to meet set targets.

attributes.title: Cash Count
attributes.description:
·       A cash verification was conducted to ensure that the physical cash on hand aligned with the recorded balance in the cash flow records. The review also assessed compliance with established cash management controls.

·        It was noted that expected cash had a surplus of +3.

Table 9:Cash Verification

Implications:

·       The minimal cash variance is an indication that effective controls are in place, however there is need to strengthen controls on issue of IOU to avoid time lapse before its cleared.
attributes.recommendation: The branch cashier should ensure that established controls are maintained and enhanced where necessary.
attributes.remediation_plan:
• Ensure strict adherence to cash handling procedures to eliminate discrepancies.
  • Strengthen oversight on IOUs to ensure prompt clearing of outstanding amounts.

value:
·       Cash controls in place are working effectively.

The controls are effective, but we shall follow up to ensure
The controls in place are effective and we shall maintain

attributes.title: Mini Shop Spot Check
attributes.description:
·       A spot check was carried out at the Mini Shop on February 17, 2025 to confirm that all bread loaded for sale was accurately accounted for and to ensure that recorded sales matched the balances linked to the designated pay bill number, as the Mini Shop operates on a cashless policy.

·       The expected sales amount revealed overpayments  by customers amounting to Kshs 946 i.e accounted Kshs 840 and unaccounted Kshs 106 as illustrated below:

Table 8:Mini shop spot check

Implications:

Overpayments by customers indicate a lack of proper payment verification which could lead to reconciliation issues and also implies discrepancies in tracking payments for the unaccounted balance.
attributes.recommendation: The Mini Shopkeeper should strictly ensure that customers pay the exact amount for their purchases to avoid discrepancies.
attributes.remediation_plan:
• Ensure that customers are charged the exact amount for purchases to prevent overpayments.
  • Implement a stricter reconciliation process to track and account for all transactions accurately.

value: The Mini Shopkeeper will be advised to ensure that clients only pay the exact amount for their orders.
We are advising the Mini Shop employee to ensure that clients pay the exact amount corresponding to their purchases.
In the prior audit, it was noted that all the sales done and bread balance as at the time of the spot check were accounted for.

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
·       An analysis of production efficiency was conducted to assess whether workers were meeting their set production targets of 4.3 bags per production worker and to identify areas for improvement, considering factors such as current workforce utilization, actual versus expected production, and the cost implications of inefficiencies.

·       We noted that production efficiency per production worker was at 4.11 bags, this was below the expected set standard of 4.3 bags per production worker.

·       The company incurred an additional cost of Kshs 32,598 for hiring 30 extra workers to meet production needs.

A summary of the analysis is shown below.

Table 6: Production Efficiency.

Implications

·       The failure to achieve the set production efficiency target resulted in additional labour costs, impacting overall profitability.

Machine breakdowns contributed to inefficiencies leading to underutilization of workers and the need for additional hires.
attributes.recommendation:
·       The branch needs to optimize shift planning to align workforce allocation with production demands.

·       Branch management should liaise with KAF to strengthen preventive maintenance schedules for ovens and other machinery to reduce breakdowns and downtime ensuring prompt response to equipment malfunctions to minimize production disruptions.
attributes.effect:
·       The failure to achieve the set production efficiency target resulted in additional labour costs, impacting overall profitability.·       The failure to achieve the set production efficiency target resulted in additional labour costs, impacting overall profitability.

Machine breakdowns contributed to inefficiencies leading to underutilization of workers and the need for additional hires.

Machine breakdowns contributed to inefficiencies leading to underutilization of workers and the need for additional hires.
attributes.remediation_plan:
• Adjust workforce allocation to optimize labor utilization.
  • Implement preventive maintenance for production machinery to reduce downtime.

value:
·       Machine breakdowns led to underutilization of workers.

·       There were shifts cuts thus hiring more workers to finish the production.

·       Breakdowns during this time also affected our ability to meet targets.

We are closely monitoring the situation to ensure we make up for the shortfall.

·       In the prior audit dated 9th January 2025

ü  It was noted that the production efficiency was 4.09 bags per production worker, which is slightly below the set efficiency level with extra 24 workers hired.
